values:
Well, I'm in Mexico kids. For the summer. I've been here a week now and I'll be here until August 1. It is still a little strange living in someone else's some in another country, attending a foreign university, and eating different food. I have already suffered Montezuma's revenge but am recovering. 

I think after I am 100% again it will be time to take the weekends to explore the area. I have already made a list of things I want to see while I'm here. 

Anywho...just wanted to check in.

From Mexico...

Well, things are settling down a little. I went out last night and probably had a little too much to drink but that's what college does to you. 

Monon Bell is this weekend and I feel weird not going but I'll be there in spirit I suppose: Wabash Always Fights! I guess its weird because I don't know if I'm still friends with those guys or how it all worked out. 

Purdue's last home game is tomorrow and I'm pretty excited. Hopefully we'll win and eventually play in a decent bowl game. *crosses fingers*

Well, Happy Friday everyone and here's to a relaxing weekend!

Whoa! The summer is flying by. It has definitely been the best summer of my life :-D

I'm going to visit my grandparents this weekend with Ahson and I'm so excited to have a laid-back weekend with some of my favorite people. 

Now until school is pretty busy but I'm going to do as much as I can to enjoy it :)

Things to look forward to:
-This weekend with the grandparents in the middle of nowhere
-Brett's show
-maybe the RCA's sometime this week???
-seeing good friends
-Third Eye Blind concert
-spending more time with Ahson
-hanging out with my dad



***Through all the trials and tribulations, people can improve themselves and grow closer to others who experience the same things. Life isn't about avoiding or not having problems...problems will occur and situations will have flaws, as well as people. Its not about NOT having these instances but rather dealing with them in a sensible manner. Keep your head on straight and be reasonable. Nothing is perfect but you can definitely make the most out of any situation. 



I'm loving this summer :)

Yesterday was a wonderful day and wonderful evening. I got to go swimming with Ahson and we played Clue with his mom...haha...it was a great time. 

Today I got to hang out with dearest brother. Twas lovely. 

Tomorrow has to be another great one :)

I'm looking forward to visiting my grandparents :)


I am at ease.

The concert with my dearest K friend was flippin awesome!!!!! 

I'm feeling great about things right now :)

I've been hanging out with friends more, including those I haven't spent quality time with for a long time, and it has been great! 



*giggle*

Moose Juice.
Does anyone want to go to a Fall Out Boy concert with me on Tuesday? I have another ticket and don't want to go alone.

Why is summer always such a busy time? The car wash isn't so bad really and I have gotten to spend a lot of time with Ahson lately *wonderful* but it seems like its already flying by! Workin, seeing people, etc. Tomorrow I'm getting my hair trimmed. I'm thinking about growing it out again and cutting it all off for Locks of Love. We'll see but that is my current plan. Friday, Ahson and I are going to see Brett in his show *Yay* and whatever else may happen! Crazy!

Next week is going to be another busy one. On Monday, Ahson, his mom, and I are going to Fort Wayne to check out the campus and where he'll be in the fall. I'm so proud of him and I'm excited to see what it'll be like. Then Wednesday through Sunday is HOBY!!!!!!!!!!! I am so incredibly pumped. I FINALLY get to be a counselor and I am beyond excited. I hope my excitement continues through the seminar. 

Well, ladies and gents, its time for me to maybe read a little and go to bed. 

G'nite.

Was at the car wash for a very long time today but it was a gorgeous day :)



Who has the seasons of Gilmore Girls and wants to let me borrow them?



Its the weekend. 




Soooooooo happy.

Congrats to all the 2007 graduates! Congrats to Ahson who graduated Cum Laude from Wasbash :-D 
I had dinner with Ahson's family and it was lovely. My dad, aunt, and uncle came to his graduation and everything went very well :)

The one thing about graduation is that I learned this year that those who say they will keep in touch not always do. I lost touch with people I thought I would always be able to talk to and be good friends for a while after they graduated. I hope to keep in contact with those who graduated this year because they have played a very large role in my college life and I would be sad to lose that all of a sudden. 

Oh well. I have 2 years left but I'm officially a Senior! wOOt! 


Well, time to relax.

School is done. I am officially a senior and have 2 years left to complete my double major. Had a great weekend. I'm sooooooooooooo excited for HOBY this year. The theme is "HOBY Rocks the World" and all the group names are rock bands. Mine is Aerosmith. Hell yeah! Got to hang out with Ahson and his brothers a bit this weekend. Lovely time indeed. 

Its summer. Now what? haha It feels so strange not having a set schedule yet. Soon I'll be working but right now, I'm basking in the relaxation. 


Its Monday and its almost time to help Ahson pack up. 


People who want to see me: Call me and let me know. I'm living in Lafayette this summer.

This always happens at the end of the semester but it has never hit me so hard. Many of my good friends in Tomahawk are graduating. Granted, a few of them will not be far away but there are a couple who will be states away in less than a month. This makes me sad. Sad that they won't be around and doing stuff in Tomahawk and sad that I didn't spend more time with them while they were here. Ahson is also graduating and going on to medical school. Hopefully, he won't be too far away but there will be some adjusting. Some of Ahson's brothers who are friends are graduating as well. Things are changing drastically for me and I'm trying to get prepared. 

At the end of the year or the semester, I think everyone goes through the "if" deck saying what they could've done academically: "Oh, I should've studied more or been more organized." "I should've tried harder in general." Or socially: "I should've spent more time with (----) while they were here." These statements can drive a person mad. Yesterday, I realized that the semester is almost over. All I have left is 1 paper and 2 finals and the semester will be over. Yes, I have tried this semester but my classes have been super challenging, I've had an incredibly busy semester, and have tried to spend as much time with Ahson and my friends as possible. I've come to the conclusion that my classes were difficult, my time was spread thin, and I did my best to find a balance in regard to all activities. 

I understand that people graduate and move on but I have never had so many people so close to me graduate at the same time. And its even crazier to think that I will technically be a Senior next year! Yes, I still have 2 years left but how strange is that? We are all growing up so fast and I don't want things to get so busy that I can't even see my friends anymore. I plan on savoring the time my friends before they move on and that Ahson and I can spend lots of quality time this summer. 

I wish all the gradates best of luck in the future and I hope life turns out the way you want it to be. I hope we keep in touch and that life allows us to talk every once in a while. Ahson, I know you'll excel in medical school and I'll be right here all the way :) 

The world is changing. My world is changing right in front of my eyes and I am trying desperately to keep up.

I just want to make everyone's problems go away. Make school and professors more understanding. Make sleep unrequired so students can actually survive the end of the semester. And most of all, make everyone feel good about themselves. Schools tends to get to people, including myself, and take away confidence and replace it with frustration and sadness or anger. I know school is supposed to be challenging and somewhat difficult but when did it become so emotionally taxing? And why is this necessary? 


Hang in there everyone. We're almost done. Remember to breathe. Keep your chin up. And just take one thing at a time. 

Everything will work out and be okay. 


*hugs*


Edit:
I just saw a report that said suicide is the second leading cause of death in college students with roughly 1100 each year. I don't want my friends to become part of this statistic. Is there anything we as college students can do? *sigh* Don't ever let it get this bad. The sun will shine on a new day and opens the door for new possibilities.

So I didn't think this week was going to be that stressful...until I got sick last night. I must have eaten something that was bad because I got very sick, very fast. I didn't go to campus today and I rested. I have 2 tests on Friday. I have 2 Spanish oral presentations next week. I am feeling a little stressed at the moment and I am still recovering from the bad-food illness plus a cold I've had for a couple weeks. Bah! Oh well, I suppose that means its just getting closer towards the end of the semester. 

I am very much looking forward to the weekends, though. :) xoxoxo


Well, I suppose I should get back to studying for my tests on Friday.

I had a FANTASTIC weekend!

Friday was amazing:
One class canceled. 
Got to see a good friend named Mike. 
Got a test back in Spanish 402: 94%...hell yeah!
Got to have dinner with Seth, Topher, Manda, and her friend then watched "Little Miss Sunshine"...I just love that movie. 

Saturday:
Spent some time with Ahson.
Spent time with Ahson's mom, Carol.
Went to Ahson's concert at UIndy...my parents even went! 

Sunday:
Breakfast at the Three Sisters Cafe to celebrate 1 and 1/2 years :-D
Chillin and a short nap
Very productive afternoon/evening!

Trying to write my Spanish research paper due in a week...oh well...not much longer!

Hang in there everyone!

Yesterday started my "Karla needs to get in shape" plan. I am doing well so far :-D

School....a lot to do in the next few weeks but its only a few weeks.

Life is good :)

Hope all is well in lj world.

So excited its the weekend!!!!!!!!! Hooray!


Tomahawk stuff tonight. Hanging out with Ahson and seeing a play tomorrow. 

wOOt!



Life is much better.

This past weekend was one of the most fabulous weekends I have ever had. :-D

The week is going pretty well. I have an exam and a paper due tomorrow...bleh...but not much else for the rest of the week...hooray!

__The Lakota Way__ by Joseph Marshall, III is amazing!

Sometimes I just don't make the right decisions...

that won't happen again...

I'm so lucky...

very excited for the weekend...

actually about 8 hours from now :-D


"Its tough to find people who love you no matter what"

He did it. 

Ahson did it.

Ahson is going to IU Med School :-D

I'm so proud, excited, and just happy....

Yay!!!

First week of school was kinda rough. Oh well. I just need to get used to working more and sleeping less. 

THE FRAY WAS AWESOME! I even enjoyed Mute Math, the opening band. I thought they were new and innovative and quite delightful. 

I'm going to enjoy the 3-day weekend to the fullest.

Well, back at Purdue. Last night was a lovely night at LeeAnn's *thanks again, darlin*

Had a wonderful morning :-D

Time to do some laundry and relax a little. 


...no matter what, there is always something to be grateful for.

Wooohoo!!! Happy New Year to all! The New Year has already started off well. I got to have a brunch with my family and the past couple days with Ahson since we both have the time off. I'm not quite sure what I'm going to do tomorrow...maybe go sailing with my dad and his friend, Dr. Bob. We shall see. I am planning on heading back to Lafayette on Thursday. *sigh* Back to school...but I still have time to see people! haha

Ahson's interview at IU for Med School is tomorrow...please be sending him good thoughts :-D

;)

Just trying to end my vacation with some fun :)

Thank goodness Christmas Eve is over. Christmas day was actually the best its been in quite some time :)

I am trying to make plans with people since next week is my last week of break. Brett, call me. I think I am going to be in Lafayette tomorrow all day if any Laffy people read this. Call me! :)

Other than that, life is pretty great.

For the past week, almost, I have been: cranky, tired, restless, sore, feeling ill, picky, irritable, annoying, emotional, and down-right mean. 

Anyone who can put up with me with all ^ that going on is a saint. 

Ahson, thank you. I know I'm not perfect and I'm sorry...the holidays are always a little more difficult. I love you and thank you so much for being my rock. 


I feel as if I have been acting like an ass. Its awful. I think I just needed a little down-time. *sigh* Oh well...I hope I haven't screwed anything up. 


*hoping*

WOOOHOO!!! My grades are much much MUCH better than I expected. *whew*

Concert last night rocked. It was amazing to see my friend almost get in a fight with some teenage girls...lol...you had to be there. 

Looking forward to tonight and tomorrow's at Kelsee's!

:-D

Already had Christmas with one side of grandparents. It was lovely to see them. I think they are wonderful people and I wish my entire family had the same personality. 

Tonight is a dinner at the Cheesecake Factory with some girls from high school. Should be interesting. More updates later. 

Tomorrow I'm going to a concert in Chicago with Ahson, Kristin, and Jeni. It should be a good time :)

Wednesday I'm finally getting a hair cut! Its so weird to think this is long when it used to be half-way down my back. Crazy. Evening possibly a get-together at my Aunt Jody's. 

Thursday is Kelsee's dinner party. wOOt!

Friday: ???? Maybe go see Night at the Museum :-D I REALLY want to see it. 

Sunday is Christmas at my Grandma's in Martinsville...bleh. Always interesting though. 


A busy week with just enough time to relax. I love spending time with my dad but its sad that he is ill :( Send 'get well' thoughts his way, please. 



Done with finals. Grades probably won't be too great...*sigh* but it is vacation and I am going to enjoy it :-D 


Love love lovies!

Xmas Stocking
leave a gift for krazy4koko
your username:
your gift: (30 characters or less)

get your stocking

Well, dead week is not even close to being dead. I am doing pretty well keeping up with academics and social aspects. Tonight are Tomahawk elections and critiques...wish me luck. 

Tomorrow: class, lunch with a friend, guest speaking, homework, dinner with another friend


Should be a wonderful day!

Almost to the weekend!!!! Yay!!!


Just watched Polar Express with Manda...I'm filled with Christmas spirit :-D 


xoxoxoxoxoxo

Rant:

So I calculated my prospective GPA for this semester and I am pissed. I have worked so hard and for what? For a mediocre grade that doesn't properly represent my ethics as a student or my passion for what I am studying? Why must students wade through the shit of professors' problems and ego-trips? Why must we all suffer from those awful professors that make us think twice about our majors? This sucks. I feel so incredibly frustrated and I am trying...I really am. But the more professors beat me down with undeserved grades, the more I am inclined to say "fuck it" and move on. What is happening? I used to be able to get good grades and now I feel like I am slipping. I feel like I owe it to so many people so do well, including myself. I just try to keep telling myself that employers won't look too closely at my GPA but my 2 degrees instead. This only covers up my frustration and anger with myself and professors. Maybe I am losing my intelligence....maybe this is the wrong path for me. *screams* I really just need someone to tell me its going to be okay and not expect perfection when I can't even get average these days. I guess no one can help me since I can't even help myself.



*sniffle*

What a wonderful weekend:

Friday: Progressive Dinner with Tomahawk and time with Ahson :)
Saturday: Breakfast Clubbing with Ahson and some Tomahawk peeps
          The game!!! BOILER UP! 28-19 *evil laughter*
          Dinner at Logan's
          The Prestige *awesome*
Today: lovely breakfast :-D 
       cleaning, organizing, homework....basically catching up


Hope everyone is doing well and its almost Thanksgiving! :)



:)

Weekend was pretty darn great. Wabash won the rugby match and the Monon Bell. Sunday I went to Chicago to see my dearest brother Brett *great show darling*. The ride there and back was quite an adventure but we made it home safely :)

This week is busy just like every other week. I have the first version of a 7-10 page paper due tomorrow *yuck* but I am on task and hopefully will have a great rest of the week!


Yesterday was Seth's birthday and we went out to dinner...twas lovely. Looking forward to the weekend and break...oh, doesn't everyone need a break?

Last week was just terrible. But its over!!! Things are pretty busy but sooooo much better. Had an awesome weekend! Dad, Diane, Ahson, and I went to the B.B. King concert up here and it was freakin sweet. Bought The Fray tickets today. Oh man, great day. 

Just going to keep truckin through the week and look forward to the amazing weekend coming up!
I don't listen as much as I should. I think it pushes people away. I care. I do but sometimes it is nice for you to listen. The stress is getting to me and I don't like it one bit.

I don't mind where you come from
As long as you come to me
I don't like illusions I can't see
Them clearly

I don't care no I wouldn't dare
To fix the twist in you
You've shown me eventually
What you'll do

I don't mind...
I don't care...
As long are you're here

Go ahead tell me you'll leave again
You'll just come back running
Holding your scarred heart in hand
It's all the same
And I'll take you for who you are
If you take me for everything
Do it all over again
It's all the same

Hours slide and days go by
Till you decide to come
And in between it always seems too long
All of a sudden

And I have the skill, yeah I have the will
To breathe you in while I can
However long you stay
Is all that I am

I don't mind...
I don't care...
As long are you're here

Go ahead tell me you'll leave again
You'll just come back running
Holding your scarred heart in hand
It's all the same
And I'll take you for who you are
If you take me for everything
Do it all over again
It's always the same

Wrong or right
Black or white
If I close my eyes
I's all the same

In my life
The compromise
I close my eyes
It's all the same

Go ahead say it you're leaving
You'll just come back running
Holding your scarred heart in hand
It's all the same
And I'll take you for who you are
If you take me for everything
Do it all over again
It's all the same



everyone should watch this video: http://www.beatking.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=23882

BEFORE:
I was asking myself many questions. Why did I become so cynical? How did I get here? I used to never let anything bother me. I would let little things slide. I would not let my day be ruined by an off-the-wall comment or someone else in a bad mood. It was so frustrating and I felt like I was in a rut. A rut with school, with friends and a little with family. What could I do? What is wrong? Who has made me feel so bad? Why have I done this to myself?

AFTER:
Today was a wonderful day. I woke up ready for the day to begin. Yes, school is a bit frustrating but I need to face it head-on. Friends are fantastic. Family is always family and I am so grateful to have my dad. Ahson is more than amazing. I just need to boost my self-confidence and be the Karla I know I can be! Yes, I was in a rut but I am shaping up and getting back in the swing of things. 


Thank you to everyone who has been so wonderful. Ahson, you put the biggest smile on my face :) Thanks for all your support xoxoxoxo

My life is amazing! How could I forget???? *giggle*

The concert was awesome!!! 

I was glad at least a few people showed up last night.

Now it is time for tons of homework so I'm not screwed this week.

Question everything. Everyone. Every situation. At any particular moment, something could change your life forever. Circumstances, fate, destiny-whatever you want to call it can play a part in day of your life. Any person you meet could be a good friend, a significant other or someone who will impact your life without knowing it. Do you pay attention to those around you? Have you thanked those who have made a difference in your life? Are you lucky to have amazing friends? How did you become friends? Was it through school? Other friends you aren't even friends with anymore or just pure coincidence? It is strange the way we pave our way through life without ever noticing how we get where we do. Do you believe it is fate? Do you believe you have gotten there on your own with no help from any other outside sources? 

I suppose I am trying to say that I believe there have been some amazing influences and a bit of destiny has played a major part in my life. Without some past events, friends or school functions I would not be so lucky. However, I am and I thank my stars every night for my wonderful life :)

The simple things in life count...those little things that happen daily that go unnoticed until they are no longer there. Appreciate them now, while you have a chance. 



I am the luckiest.

The week was long...very long. Tomahawk was every single night, I had 2 "field trips", and lots of homework and not so much sleep. 

Friday was fantastic! I got to hang out with Seth and we saw Flyboys. Then I went to a pub and got to see Joel and  Topher. I got to see 3 of my favorite people in the same night! I got to talk to Bitsy not too long ago and hopefully will get to see her this week some time, along with Seth and Topher and some more of my favorites! :)

Yesterday was so fun. Walk for Diabetes was in the morning, 6 a.m. to noon so I was up at 4:45 a.m. roughly. After the Walk, went to Wabash. Courtney Jean came up and Amy was here too. We all went to the football game and had dinner. We girls went to watch the Homecoming Concert with Glee Club and other groups. After that was the Hootie and the Blowfish concert! It was pretty great...it was a great night. Then the rest of the night was just mingling and talking with people. I got to catch up with a few and it was wonderful, let me tell you. I miss some of my friends. I miss talking to them on a regular basis and knowing how they are doing and what's going on in their lives. I just don't want to lose them...


Today was just chillin with Ahson at Wabash. I am staying here tonight and then going home tomorrow for the day. Then back up to Lafayette to do lots of work :)

Hope those on Fall Break enjoy it and to those who are not yet, have fun when you get there! :)

Yesterday, October 2, was our anniversary. One year and I've never been happier :-D I love you, Ahson xoxoxoxo



This week is crazy busy as usual but I am looking forward to it :) Also looking forward to the weekend :)


Oh man, must keep going!!!

Had a marvelous weekend :)


The week is going to be long.




ATTENTION: Does anyone want tickets to the Death Cab for Cutie concert Tuesday, November 14 in Indy??? Let me know ASAP!




Up at 3:30 tomorrow morning....ugh....back to studying

Wow...this week has flown by! Busy busy busy. Today should be relatively busy but great!!!! :) The weekend shall include a trip to Broad Ripple's Crackers Comedy Club. Sunday more Tomahawk-ing. 

BOILER UP tomorrow!



Have a great weekend, all :)

What a wonderful weekend :-D 

I had a lovely chat with a very good friend this weekend. That friend of mine is one that I have not had the pleasure of having many conversations with lately. Truly wonderful. He reminded me that there are friends you will find and hold on to who will be there through anything and everything. I have noticed some friends falling off to the wayside but I could have a really good conversation with him even though I've only been able to say hi a few times in the past month or so. It is one of the best feelings to be able to open up and talk about anything and have the conversation lead to some life lesson neither of us ever thought of before. After I think about where I was a year ago, I am amazed. I have changed and I am in love and life is so wonderful. Crazy the way life takes certain turns along the way but still everyone ends up where they should. 

It was a very reflective and memorable weekend. *hugs* Thanks to all who made that possible. 


Busy, busy week ahead of me but Monday has been excellent so far.

Weekend's plans: 
Tonight-go to a friend's to spend the night

Tomorrow:
Wake up and go to Breakfast Club
Homecoming!!!!
Wabash for a Toga Party 



WHoa man....a funfilled weekend. 

Here I go!!!

Friend Survey
IF YOU'RE ON MY FRIENDS LIST,
I want to know 28 things about you. I don't care if we've never talked, never liked each other, or if we already know everything about each other. I really don't*). You are obviously on my list, so let me know with whom I am friends!

*) Actually, I do care if we like each other or not, so if you don't like me, please cut me from your list. Thank you.

1.Your Middle Name:
2. Age:
3. Single or Taken:
4. Favourite Movie:
5. Favourite Song:
6. Favourite Band/Artist:
7. Dirty or Clean:
8. Tattoos and/or Piercings:


1. Do we know each other outside of LJ?
2. What's your philosophy on life?
3. Would you have my back in a fight?
4. Would you keep a secret from me if you thought it was in my best interest?
5. What is your favourite memory of us?
6. Would you give me a kidney?
7. Tell me one odd/interesting fact about you:
8. Would you take care of me when I'm sick?
9. Can we get together and make a cake?
10. Have you heard any rumours of me lately?
11. Do you/have you talk(ed) crap about me?
12. Do you think I'm a good person?
13. Would you drive across country with me?
14. Do you think I'm attractive?
15. If you could change anything about me, would you?
16. What do you wear to sleep?
17. Would you come over for no reason just to hang out?
18. Would you go on a date with me if i asked you?
19. If I only had one day to live, what would we do together?
20. Will you repost this so I can fill it out for you?

I talked to my brother. I talked to Ahson. I talked to Heather. I talked to Andrew Ward. 

I am more determined than ever. I am stronger than ever. I won't let you stop me. 

Watch out universe!!! Here I come!!!!

Besides, Karma can be a mean lady ;) She takes care of things all by herself.

This bothers me and I know it was directed at me and maybe some others:

Why is it majortity of the people I know who happen to be majoring in some type of education shouldn't be teaching? If you're becoming a teacher, let me know where you plan on working, so I can live elsewhere.

_________________________________________________________________________________________________

I think I am going to be a great teacher. And despite some beliefs, honesty is a good thing along with constructive criticism. How is it that I get in trouble for being honest but others don't, especially when that person ASKED for suggestions! Its bull and I don't particular like it when I am the one who is trying to help but I am thrown under the bus....???

I don't feel well physically and I don't feel well mentally.

I must say that I am so lucky to have found such an amazing boyfriend. He is my rock and is my everything. I love him to pieces and can't thank him enough for everything. Thanks, Ahson. You're more than I ever wanted ;) xo

In other news, I have a cold. It is getting worse. Sneezing, coughing, congestion. bleh.

I am frustrated with some school things...it will pass or get better, I am hoping. 

I am trying to get some work done but I just feel so drained that it is a little difficult to keep up. 



I feel lucky...I feel like I can do anything I put my mind to. Bring it on, universe. Bring it on.

JOHN MAYER AND SHERYL CROW IN CONCERT TODAY!!!!

wOOt!

Last night was fun. Today will be excellent! 

Have a great weekend, all!!!

Today was a good day until this afternoon. I had to see World Trade Center for one of my classes and I still can't get over the visual of people jumping out of the building or the faces of the relatives. I can't shake how I felt when my dad was activated and I didn't really see him the next 6 months or the mornings he was shipped out. I can't. And I hate that I had to see it and be reminded of how horrible it was. I hate that those people made the movie and if you can't remember September 11...where were you?



*sigh*
